description:
Researcher at University of Nottingham & NIHR Applied Research Collaboration East Midlands.
Interested in dementia, inequalities & digital #publichealthsky #gerontology

The NIHR Applied Research Collaboration (ARC) West is one of 15 @nihrarcs.bsky.social funded by the National Institute for Health and Care Research (@nihr.bsky.social). We work with our partners in the West of England on applied health and care research

One of 15 Applied Research Collaborations (@nihrarcs.bsky.social) funded by (@nihr.bsky.social).

We support applied health & care research across Cornwall, Devon, Somerset, and beyond.

More from us: linktr.ee/nihrpenarc
Clinical academic physio. Professor at University of Exeter. NIHR Senior Investigator. Frailty. falls. Community rehab
Academic geriatrician; NIHR Newcastle BRC and HRC; BGS vice-president for research. Ageing, Sarcopenia, MLTC, better trials for and with older people, big data and a dash of global health.

REVAL is a NIHR Rapid Service Evaluation Team based at the University of Manchester.

https://sites.manchester.ac.uk/reval/
NIHR Academic Clinical Lecturer in General Practice at the University of Exeter, Associate Editor of the BJGP, GP, and Clinical Data Quality Lead at the CPRD. More importantly to me: Mum, and surfer.
Did my Milkshake bring you here? Research Manager at the NIHR. Former PhD. Musical Obsessive. Huge Geek. Gaymer. Innuendo Extraordinaire. Shiba Dog Dad. He/Him.

display_name: NIHR Oxford Health Biomedical Research Centre
description: The OH BRC, based at  Oxford Health NHS FT is run in partnership with University of Oxford with 13 partner university and NHS Trusts across England.
Supporting applied health and care research for local populations in the West Midlands. One of 15 regional @nihr.bsky.social Applied Research Collaborations  â€“ @nihrarcs.bsky.social

Professor of Social Science Applied to Health and Care at the University of Bristol Medical School; NIHR Applied Research Collaboration West implementation lead and acting director. Researching implementation and inequalities using qualitative methods.
The NIHR ARC East Midlands is one of 15 ARCs (@nihrarcs.bsky.social) supporting applied health and care research, funded by the National Institute for Health and Care Research (@nihr.bsky.social).
NIHR Academic Clinical Lecturer in General Adult Psychiatry at the University of Southampton

display_name: NIHR Applied Research Collaboration North East & North Cumbria
description:
Working together to achieve better, fairer health and care at all ages and in all places. One of 15 Applied Research Collaborations (ARCs) @nihrarcs.bsky.social in England. Funded by @nihr.bsky.social

Visit our website at www.arc-nenc.nihr.ac.uk
Mental health researcher, co-lead for NIHR Mental Health Research Initiative in the South West Peninsula, (un)committed trail runner, childless cat lady, some time surfer and singer.

display_name: Applied Research Collaboration North West Coast (ARC NWC)
description:
NIHR ARC North West Coast is one of 15 @nihrarcs.bsky.social
funded by the National Institute for Health and Care Research (@nihr.bsky.social). We work with our partners in the North West of England on applied health and care research.
We are part of the National Institute for Health and Care Research and hosted by South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust in partnership with King's College London. www.maudsleybrc.nihr.ac.uk
PhD. Researcher at the University of Bristol and part of the health economic team at NIHR ARC West (@arc-west.bsky.social). Interested in implementation science.
Senior Lecturer at the University of Exeter Medical School and NIHR ARC South West Peninsula.

Researching experiences of MSK pain in children and young people in the UK.

Based at Keele University, funded by the NIHR
